alert.note: Alert for St. Marys (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued April 28 at 3:16PM EDT until April 28 at 4:00PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... ...COASTAL FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM EDT SATURDAY... ...COASTAL FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 2 AM EDT SATURDAY THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the Coastal Flood Warning, up to one foot of inundation above ground level expected in low lying areas due to tidal flooding. For the Coastal Flood Watch, up to one half foot of inundation above ground level possible in low lying areas due to tidal flooding. * WHERE...Shoreline in St. Marys County. * WHEN...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, until 4 PM EDT this afternoon, especially around the time of high tide. For the Coastal Flood Warning, until 2 AM EDT Saturday, especially around the time of high tide. For the Coastal Flood Watch, from 2 AM EDT Saturday through Saturday afternoon, especially around the time of high tide. * IMPACTS...At 3.5 feet, water covers roads on Saint George Island, is in yards, and is approaching structures. To the east, inundation is occurring at multiple marinas off St. Mary`s River, Smith Creek, and Jutland Creek. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Tides two and a half to three feet above normal. The next high tide at Coltons Point is at 10:57 PM and 11:04 AM. The next high tide at Piney Point is at 10:21 PM and 10:28 AM. The next high tide at Point Lookout is at 9:06 PM and 9:36 AM. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. St Marys River at Straits Point MLLW Categories - Minor 3.0 ft, Moderate 3.5 ft, Major 5.0 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.4 ft, Moderate 1.9 ft, Major 3.4 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 28/10 PM 3.8 2.2 2.4 2.0 Moderate 29/10 AM 3.2 1.6 1.8 0.5 Minor 29/09 PM 2.7 1.1 1.5 0.5 None 30/11 AM 2.9 1.3 1.5 1.0 None 30/11 PM 3.0 1.4 1.6 1.0 Minor 01/10 AM 2.5 0.9 1.3 2.0 None &&
info.instruction: Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. If travel is required, do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth.
